access_key.description: API Key used to authenticate with the rancher server

api_url.description: The URL to the rancher API

ca_certs.description: CA certificates used to sign rancher server tls certificates. Mandatory if self signed tls and insecure option false

insecure.description: Allow insecure connections to Rancher. Mandatory if self signed tls and not ca_certs provided

secret_key.description: API secret used to authenticate with the rancher server

timeout.description: Rancher connection timeout (retry every 5s). Golang duration format, ex: "60s"

token_key.description: API token used to authenticate with the rancher server

cleanup_on_fail.description: Cleanup app V2 on failed chart upgrade

deployment_values.description: Values YAML file including computed values. This field prevents incorrect discrepancies from showing in the terraform plan output when files change but values stay the same, due to additional computed values included by the provider itself.

disable_open_api_validation.description: Disable app V2 Open API Validation

system_default_registry.description: System default registry providing images for app deployment.

ca_bundle.description: CA certificate in base64-encoded DER format which will be used to validate the repo's certificate

enabled.description: If disabled the repo clone will not be updated or allowed to be installed from

exponential_backoff_max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries before returning error

exponential_backoff_max_wait.description: Maximum amount of seconds to wait before retrying

exponential_backoff_min_wait.description: Minimum amount of seconds to wait before retrying

git_branch.description: Git Repository branch containing Helm chart definitions

git_repo.description: Git Repository containing Helm chart definitions

insecure.description: Use insecure HTTPS to download the repo's index

insecure_plain_http.description: Only valid for OCI URL's. Allows insecure connections to registries without enforcing TLS checks

secret_name.description: K8s secret name to be used to connect to the repo

service_account.description: K8s service account used to deploy charts instead of the end users credentials

service_account_namespace.description: K8s namsepace of the service account

url.description: URL to an index generated by Helm

cluster_id.description: The cluster id of imported Harvester cluster

cluster_type.description: Harvester cluster type. must be imported or external

default_pod_security_admission_configura.description: Default pod security admission configuration template name

block.description: Optional Agent Env Vars for Rancher agent

cloud_credential_id.description: The AKS Cloud Credential ID to use

dns_prefix.description: The AKS dns prefix. Required if `import=false`

kubernetes_version.description: The kubernetes master version. Required if `import=false`

linux_ssh_public_key.description: The AKS linux ssh public key

log_analytics_workspace_group.description: The AKS log analytics workspace group

log_analytics_workspace_name.description: The AKS log analytics workspace name

network_dns_service_ip.description: The AKS network dns service ip

network_docker_bridge_cidr.description: The AKS network docker bridge cidr

network_plugin.description: The AKS network plugin. Required if `import=false`

node_resource_group.description: The AKS node resource group name

outbound_type.description: The AKS outbound type for the egress traffic

virtual_network_resource_group.description: The AKS virtual network resource group

availability_zones.description: The AKS node pool availability zones

enable_auto_scaling.description: Is AKS node pool auto scaling enabled?

max_count.description: The AKS node pool max count

max_pods.description: The AKS node pool max pods

max_surge.description: The AKS node pool max surge

min_count.description: The AKS node pool min count

orchestrator_version.description: The AKS node pool orchestrator version

os_disk_size_gb.description: The AKS node pool os disk size gb

os_disk_type.description: The AKS node pool os disk type

os_type.description: Enable AKS node pool os type

vm_size.description: The AKS node pool vm size

block.description: The AKS node pools to use. Required if `import=false`

override_affinity.description: User defined affinity to override default agent affinity

block.description: User defined tolerations to append to agent

cpu_limit.description: The maximum CPU limit for agent

cpu_request.description: The minimum CPU required for agent

memory_limit.description: The maximum memory limit for agent

memory_request.description: The minimum memory required for agent

block.description: User defined resource requirements to set on the agent

max_unavailable.description: The maximum number of cattle cluster agent replicas that can be down at a given time.

min_available.description: The minimum number of cattle cluster agent replicas that must be running at a given time.

block.description: The Pod Disruption Budget created for the cattle cluster agent

preemption_policy.description: The preemption behavior for the cattle cluster agent. Must be either 'PreemptLowerPriority' or 'Never'

value.description: The priority value for the cattle cluster agent. Must be between negative 1 billion and 1 billion.

block.description: The Priority Class created for the cattle cluster agent

initial_node_count.description: The GKE node pool config initial node count

max_pods_constraint.description: The GKE node pool config max pods constraint

name.description: The GKE node pool config name

version.description: The GKE node pool config version

enabled.description: Enable GKE node pool config autoscaling

max_node_count.description: The GKE node pool config max node count

min_node_count.description: The GKE node pool config min node count

block.description: The GKE node pool config autoscaling

disk_size_gb.description: The GKE node config disk size (Gb)

disk_type.description: The GKE node config disk type

image_type.description: The GKE node config image type

local_ssd_count.description: The GKE node config local ssd count

machine_type.description: The GKE node config machine type

oauth_scopes.description: The GKE node config oauth scopes

service_account.description: The GKE node config service account

block.description: The GKE node pool node config

auto_repair.description: Enable GKE node pool config management auto repair

auto_upgrade.description: Enable GKE node pool config management auto upgrade

block.description: The GKE node pool config management

master_ipv4_cidr_block.description: The GKE cluster private master ip v4 cidr block

cluster_type.description: Optionally specify a cluster type of basic or enhanced

compartment_id.description: The OCID of the compartment in which to create resources (VCN, worker nodes, etc.)

control_plane_subnet_name.description: The (optional) name of a pre-existing subnet (public or private) for the Kubernetes API endpoint

custom_boot_volume_size.description: An optional custom boot volume size (in GB) for the nodes

description.description: An optional description of this cluster

enable_private_control_plane.description: Whether Kubernetes API endpoint is a private IP only accessible from within the VCN

enable_private_nodes.description: Whether worker nodes are deployed into a new private subnet

eviction_grace_duration.description: The optional grace period in minutes to allow cordon and drain to complete successfuly

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint corresponding to the specified user's private API Key

flex_memory_in_gbs.description: Optional amount of memory in GB for nodes (requires flexible node_shape)

flex_ocpus.description: Optional number of OCPUs for nodes (requires flexible node_shape)

force_delete_after_grace_duration.description: Whether to send a SIGKILL signal if a pod does not terminate within the specified grace period

image_verification_kms_key_id.description: Optional specify a comma separated list of master encryption key OCID(s) to verify images

kms_key_id.description: Optional specify the OCID of the KMS Vault master key

kubernetes_version.description: The Kubernetes version that will be used for your master *and* worker nodes e.g. v1.33.1

limit_node_count.description: Optional limit on the total number of nodes in the pool

load_balancer_subnet_name_1.description: The name of the first existing subnet to use for Kubernetes services / LB

load_balancer_subnet_name_2.description: The (optional) name of a second existing subnet to use for Kubernetes services / LB

node_image.description: The OS for the node image

node_pool_dns_domain_name.description: Optional name for DNS domain of node pool subnet

node_pool_subnet_name.description: Optional pre-existing subnet (public or private) for nodes

node_public_key_contents.description: The contents of the SSH public key file to use for the nodes

node_shape.description: The shape of the node (determines number of CPUs and  amount of memory on each node)

node_user_data_contents.description: The contents of custom cloud-init / user_data for the nodes - will be base64 encoded internally if it is not already

pod_cidr.description: Optional specify the pod CIDR, defaults to 10.244.0.0/16

pod_network.description: Optional Pod Network plugin. Choose flannel or native. Defaults to flannel

pod_subnet_name.description: The (optional) name of a pre-existing subnet that pods will be assigned IPs from when using native pod networking

private_key_contents.description: The private API key file contents for the specified user, in PEM format

private_key_passphrase.description: The passphrase of the private key for the OKE cluster

quantity_of_node_subnets.description: Number of node subnets (defaults to creating 1 regional subnet)

quantity_per_subnet.description: Number of worker nodes in each subnet / availability domain

region.description: The availability domain within the region to host the OKE cluster

service_cidr.description: Optional specify the service CIDR, defaults to 10.96.0.0/16

service_dns_domain_name.description: Optional name for DNS domain of service subnet

tenancy_id.description: The OCID of the tenancy in which to create resources

user_ocid.description: The OCID of a user who has access to the tenancy/compartment

vcn_compartment_id.description: The OCID of the compartment (if different from compartment_id) in which to find the pre-existing virtual network set with vcn_name.

vcn_name.description: The optional name of an existing virtual network to use for the cluster creation. A new VCN will be created if not specified.

worker_node_ingress_cidr.description: Additional CIDR from which to allow ingress to worker nodes

addon_job_timeout.description: Optional duration in seconds of addon job.

addons.description: Optional addons descripton to deploy on rke cluster.

addons_include.description: Optional addons yaml manisfest to deploy on rke cluster.

ignore_docker_version.description: Optional ignore docker version on nodes

prefix_path.description: Optional prefix to customize kubernetes path

win_prefix_path.description: Optional prefix to customize kubernetes path for windows

machine_labels.description: Labels for the machine pool nodes

max_unhealthy.description: max unhealthy nodes for automated replacement to be allowed

node_drain_timeout.description: seconds to wait for machine pool drain to complete before machine deletion

node_startup_timeout_seconds.description: seconds a new node has to become active before it is replaced

unhealthy_node_timeout_seconds.description: seconds an unhealthy node has to become active before it is replaced

name.description: The name of the K8s object

dynamic.description: If ture, the file is ignored when determining whether the node should be drained before updating the node plan (default: true).

The configmap which is the source of files

default_permissions.description: The default permissions to be applied when they are not set at the item level

name.description: The name of the K8s object

dynamic.description: If ture, the file is ignored when determining whether the node should be drained before updating the node plan (default: true).

hash.description: The base64 encoded value of the SHA256 checksum of the file's content

key.description: The key of the item(file) to retrieve

path.description: The path to put the file in the target node

permissions.description: The numeric representation of the file permissions

block.description: Items(files) to retrieve from the K8s object
The secret which is the source of files

tls_secret_name.description: Registry TLS secret name. TLS is a pair of Cert/Key

services.description: Service certificates to rotate with this generation.

control_plane_concurrency.description: How many controlplane nodes should be upgrade at time, 0 is infinite. Percentages are also accepted

worker_concurrency.description: How many worker nodes should be upgrade at time

delete_empty_dir_data.description: Drain options delete empty dir data

skip_wait_for_delete_timeout_seconds.description: Drain options skip wait for delete timeout seconds

delete_empty_dir_data.description: Drain options delete empty dir data

skip_wait_for_delete_timeout_seconds.description: Drain options skip wait for delete timeout seconds

immutable.description: If set to true, ensures that data stored in the ConfigMap cannot be updated

temp_token.description: Generated API temporary token as helper. Should be empty

temp_token_id.description: Generated API temporary token id as helper. Should be empty

ttl.description: Token time to live in seconds

inherited_cluster_roles.description: Names of role templates whose permissions are granted by this global role in every cluster besides the local cluster

new_user_default.description: Whether or not this role should be added to new users

generate_name.description: Cluster V2 generate name. The pattern to generate machine config name. e.g  generate_name="prod-pool1" will generate "nc-prod-pool1-?????" names

block_duration_minutes.description: AWS spot instance duration in minutes (60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360)

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint URL (hostname only or fully qualified URI)

http_endpoint.description: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances

http_tokens.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests

kms_key.description: Custom KMS key ID using the AWS Managed CMK

monitoring.description: Set this flag to enable CloudWatch monitoring

open_port.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

private_address_only.description: Only use a private IP address

request_spot_instance.description: Set this flag to request spot instance

retries.description: Set retry count for recoverable failures (use -1 to disable)

security_group_readonly.description: Skip adding default rules to security groups

spot_price.description: AWS spot instance bid price (in dollar)

ssh_key_contents.description: SSH Key file contents for sshKeyContents

ssh_user.description: Set the name of the ssh user

use_private_address.description: Force the usage of private IP address

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user data

accelerated_networking.description: Use Accelerated Networking when creating a network interface for the Azure VM

availability_set.description: Azure Availability Set to place the virtual machine into

availability_zone.description: The Availability Zone that the Azure VM should be created in

client_id.description: Azure Service Principal Account ID (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

client_secret.description: Azure Service Principal Account password (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

disk_size.description: Disk size if using managed disk

dns.description: A unique DNS label for the public IP adddress

fault_domain_count.description: Fault domain count to use for availability set

location.description: Azure region to create the virtual machine

managed_disks.description: Configures VM and availability set for managed disks

no_public_ip.description: Do not create a public IP address for the machine

nsg.description: Azure Network Security Group to assign this node to (accepts either a name or resource ID, default is to create a new NSG for each machine)

open_port.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

private_address_only.description: Only use a private IP address

private_ip_address.description: Specify a static private IP address for the machine

resource_group.description: Azure Resource Group name (will be created if missing)

static_public_ip.description: Assign a static public IP address to the machine

storage_type.description: Type of Storage Account to host the OS Disk for the machine

subnet.description: Azure Subnet Name to be used within the Virtual Network

subnet_prefix.description: Private CIDR block to be used for the new subnet, should comply RFC 1918

tags.description: Tags to be applied to the Azure VM instance (e.g. key1,value1,key2,value2)

update_domain_count.description: Update domain count to use for availability set

use_private_ip.description: Use private IP address of the machine to connect

use_public_ip_standard_sku.description: Use the standard SKU when creating a Public IP for the Azure VM instance

vnet.description: Azure Virtual Network name to connect the virtual machine (in [resourcegroup:]name format)

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to apply to the Droplet

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user-data

auth_encoded_json.description: GCE service account auth json file path

external_firewall_rule_prefix.description: A prefix to be added to firewall rules created when exposing ports publicly. Required if exposing ports publicly.

internal_firewall_rule_prefix.description: A prefix to be added to an internal firewall rule created to ensure virtual machines can communicate with one another.

network.description: The network to provision virtual machines within

open_port.description: A list of ports to be opened publicly. 'external_firewall_rule_prefix' must also be set

preemptable.description: Indicates if the virtual machine can be preempted

project.description: The GCP project to create virtual machines within

scopes.description: Access scopes to be set on the virtual machine

sub_network.description: The subnetwork to provision virtual machines within

tags.description: A set of network tags to be added to each VM, in the format of 'tag1,tag2'

use_existing.description: Indicates if an existing VM should be used. This is not currently support in Rancher.

use_internal_ip.description: Indicates if the virtual machines should use an internal IP

use_internal_ip_only.description: Indicates if the virtual machines should use an internal IP only and not be assigned a public IP

username.description: The username to be set when logging into the virtual machines

vm_labels.description: A set of labels to be added to each VM, in the format of 'key1,value1,key2,value2'

zone.description: The region and zone to create virtual machines within (e.g. us-east1-b)

disk_info.description: A JSON string specifying info for the disks e.g. `{"disks":[{"imageName":"harvester-public/image-57hzg","bootOrder":1,"size":40},{"storageClassName":"node-driver-test","bootOrder":2,"size":1}]}`

network_data.description: NetworkData content of cloud-init, base64 is supported

network_info.description: A JSON string specifying info for the networks e.g. `{"interfaces":[{"networkName":"harvester-public/vlan1"},{"networkName":"harvester-public/vlan2"}]}`

user_data.description: UserData content of cloud-init, base64 is supported. If the image does not contain the qemu-guest-agent package, you must install and start qemu-guest-agent using userdata

authorized_users.description: Linode user accounts (seperated by commas) whose Linode SSH keys will be permitted root access to the created node

create_private_ip.description: Create private IP for the instance

image.description: Specifies the Linode Instance image which determines the OS distribution and base files

instance_type.description: Specifies the Linode Instance type which determines CPU, memory, disk size, etc.

region.description: Specifies the region (location) of the Linode instance

ssh_user.description: Specifies the user as which docker-machine should log in to the Linode instance to install Docker.

stackscript.description: Specifies the Linode StackScript to use to create the instance

stackscript_data.description: A JSON string specifying data for the selected StackScript

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags to apply to the the Linode resource

ua_prefix.description: Prefix the User-Agent in Linode API calls with some 'product/version'

cfgparam.description: vSphere vm configuration parameters (used for guestinfo)

clone_from.description: If you choose creation type clone a name of what you want to clone is required

cloud_config.description: Filepath to a cloud-config yaml file to put into the ISO user-data

cloudinit.description: vSphere cloud-init filepath or url to add to guestinfo

content_library.description: If you choose to clone from a content library template specify the name of the library

cpu_count.description: vSphere CPU number for docker VM

creation_type.description: Creation type when creating a new virtual machine. Supported values: vm, template, library, legacy

custom_attributes.description: vSphere custom attributes, format key/value e.g. '200=my custom value'

datastore_cluster.description: vSphere datastore cluster for virtual machine

disk_size.description: vSphere size of disk for docker VM (in MB)

folder.description: vSphere folder for the docker VM. This folder must already exist in the datacenter

graceful_shutdown_timeout.description: Duration in seconds before the graceful shutdown of the VM times out and the VM is destroyed. A force destroy will be performed when the value is zero

hostsystem.description: vSphere compute resource where the docker VM will be instantiated. This can be omitted if using a cluster with DRS

memory_size.description: vSphere size of memory for docker VM (in MB)

network.description: vSphere network where the virtual machine will be attached

os.description: Type of virtual machine OS in vSphere

pool.description: vSphere resource pool for docker VM

ssh_password.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh password

ssh_port.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh port

ssh_user.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh user

ssh_user_group.description: If using a non-B2D image the uploaded keys will need chown'ed, defaults to staff e.g. docker:staff

vapp_ip_allocation_policy.description: vSphere vApp IP allocation policy. Supported values are: dhcp, fixed, transient and fixedAllocated

vapp_ip_protocol.description: vSphere vApp IP protocol for this deployment. Supported values are: IPv4 and IPv6

vapp_transport.description: vSphere OVF environment transports to use for properties. Supported values are: iso and com.vmware.guestInfo

description.description: Description of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

name.description: Name of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

project_id.description: Project ID where k8s namespace belongs

block_duration_minutes.description: AWS spot instance duration in minutes (60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360)

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint URL (hostname only or fully qualified URI)

http_endpoint.description: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances

http_tokens.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests

kms_key.description: Custom KMS key ID using the AWS Managed CMK

monitoring.description: Set this flag to enable CloudWatch monitoring

open_port.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

private_address_only.description: Only use a private IP address

request_spot_instance.description: Set this flag to request spot instance

retries.description: Set retry count for recoverable failures (use -1 to disable)

security_group_readonly.description: Skip adding default rules to security groups

spot_price.description: AWS spot instance bid price (in dollar)

ssh_user.description: Set the name of the ssh user

use_private_address.description: Force the usage of private IP address

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user data

accelerated_networking.description: Enable Accelerated Networking when creating an Azure Network Interface

availability_set.description: Azure Availability Set to place the virtual machine into

availability_zone.description: The Azure Availability Zone the VM should be created in

client_id.description: Azure Service Principal Account ID (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

client_secret.description: Azure Service Principal Account password (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

disk_size.description: Disk size if using managed disk

dns.description: A unique DNS label for the public IP adddress

fault_domain_count.description: Fault domain count to use for availability set

location.description: Azure region to create the virtual machine

managed_disks.description: Configures VM and availability set for managed disks

no_public_ip.description: Do not create a public IP address for the machine

nsg.description: Azure Network Security Group to assign this node to (accepts either a name or resource ID, default is to create a new NSG for each machine)

open_port.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

plan.description: Purchase plan for Azure Virtual Machine (in <publisher>:<product>:<plan> format)

private_ip_address.description: Specify a static private IP address for the machine

resource_group.description: Azure Resource Group name (will be created if missing)

static_public_ip.description: Assign a static public IP address to the machine

storage_type.description: Type of Storage Account to host the OS Disk for the machine

subnet.description: Azure Subnet Name to be used within the Virtual Network

subnet_prefix.description: Private CIDR block to be used for the new subnet, should comply RFC 1918

tags.description: Tags to be applied to the Azure VM instance (e.g. key1,value1,key2,value2)

update_domain_count.description: Update domain count to use for availability set

use_private_ip.description: Use private IP address of the machine to connect

use_public_ip_standard_sku.description: Use the Standard SKU when creating a public IP for an Azure VM

vnet.description: Azure Virtual Network name to connect the virtual machine (in [resourcegroup:]name format)

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to apply to the Droplet

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user-data

disk_info.description: A JSON string specifying info for the disks e.g. `{"disks":[{"imageName":"harvester-public/image-57hzg","bootOrder":1,"size":40},{"storageClassName":"node-driver-test","bootOrder":2,"size":1}]}`

network_data.description: NetworkData content of cloud-init, base64 is supported

network_info.description: A JSON string specifying info for the networks e.g. `{"interfaces":[{"networkName":"harvester-public/vlan1"},{"networkName":"harvester-public/vlan2"}]}`

user_data.description: UserData content of cloud-init, base64 is supported. If the image does not contain the qemu-guest-agent package, you must install and start qemu-guest-agent using userdata

networks.description: Comma-separated list of network IDs or names which should be attached to the server private network interface

server_labels.description: Map of the labels which will be assigned to the server

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user-data

volumes.description: Comma-separated list of volume IDs or names which should be attached to the server

authorized_users.description: Linode user accounts (seperated by commas) whose Linode SSH keys will be permitted root access to the created node

create_private_ip.description: Create private IP for the instance

image.description: Specifies the Linode Instance image which determines the OS distribution and base files

instance_type.description: Specifies the Linode Instance type which determines CPU, memory, disk size, etc.

region.description: Specifies the region (location) of the Linode instance

ssh_user.description: Specifies the user as which docker-machine should log in to the Linode instance to install Docker.

stackscript.description: Specifies the Linode StackScript to use to create the instance

stackscript_data.description: A JSON string specifying data for the selected StackScript

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags to apply to the the Linode resource

ua_prefix.description: Prefix the User-Agent in Linode API calls with some 'product/version'

extra_tags_all.description: Extra tags for all created resources (e.g. key1=value1,key2=value2)

extra_tags_instances.description: Extra tags only for instances (e.g. key1=value1,key2=value2)

root_disk_iops.description: Iops for io1 Root Disk. From 1 to 13000.

root_disk_size.description: Size of the Root Disk (in GB). From 1 to 14901.

root_disk_type.description: Type of the Root Disk. Possible values are :'standard', 'gp2' or 'io1'.

security_group_ids.description: Ids of user defined Security Groups to add to the machine

source_omi.description: Outscale Machine Image to use as bootstrap for the VM

cfgparam.description: vSphere vm configuration parameters (used for guestinfo)

clone_from.description: If you choose creation type clone a name of what you want to clone is required

cloud_config.description: Filepath to a cloud-config yaml file to put into the ISO user-data

cloudinit.description: vSphere cloud-init filepath or url to add to guestinfo

content_library.description: If you choose to clone from a content library template specify the name of the library

cpu_count.description: vSphere CPU number for docker VM

creation_type.description: Creation type when creating a new virtual machine. Supported values: vm, template, library, legacy

custom_attributes.description: vSphere custom attributes, format key/value e.g. '200=my custom value'

datastore_cluster.description: vSphere datastore cluster for virtual machine

disk_size.description: vSphere size of disk for docker VM (in MB)

folder.description: vSphere folder for the docker VM. This folder must already exist in the datacenter

graceful_shutdown_timeout.description: Duration in seconds before the graceful shutdown of the VM times out and the VM is destroyed. A force destroy will be performed when the value is zero

hostsystem.description: vSphere compute resource where the docker VM will be instantiated. This can be omitted if using a cluster with DRS

memory_size.description: vSphere size of memory for docker VM (in MB)

network.description: vSphere network where the virtual machine will be attached

pool.description: vSphere resource pool for docker VM

ssh_password.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh password

ssh_port.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh port

ssh_user.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh user

ssh_user_group.description: If using a non-B2D image the uploaded keys will need chown'ed, defaults to staff e.g. docker:staff

vapp_ip_allocation_policy.description: vSphere vApp IP allocation policy. Supported values are: dhcp, fixed, transient and fixedAllocated

vapp_ip_protocol.description: vSphere vApp IP protocol for this deployment. Supported values are: IPv4 and IPv6

vapp_transport.description: vSphere OVF environment transports to use for properties. Supported values are: iso and com.vmware.guestInfo

description.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration template description

name.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration template name

audit.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration audit. This audits a pod in violation of privileged, baseline, or restricted policy (default: privileged)

audit_version.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration audit version (default: latest)

enforce.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration enforce. This rejects a pod in violation of privileged, baseline, or restricted policy (default: privileged)

enforce_version.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration enforce version (default: latest)

warn.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration warn. This warns the user about a pod in violation of privileged, baseline, or restricted policy (default: privileged)

warn_version.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration warn version (default: latest)

block.description: defaults allows the user to define admission control mode for Pod Security

namespaces.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration namespace exemptions

runtime_classes.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration runtime class exemptions

usernames.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration username exemptions

block.description: exemptions allows the creation of pods for specific Usernames, RuntimeClassNames, and Namespaces that would otherwise be prohibited

namespace_id.description: Namespace ID to add docker registry

project_id.description: Project ID to add docker registry

default_role.description: Default role template for new created cluster or project

block.description: External policy rules used for authorization

immutable.description: If set to true, ensures that data stored in the Secret cannot be updated

type.description: Used to facilitate programmatic handling of Secret data

ttl.description: Token time to live in seconds

exponential_backoff_max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries before returning error

exponential_backoff_max_wait.description: Maximum amount of seconds to wait before retrying

exponential_backoff_min_wait.description: Minimum amount of seconds to wait before retrying

insecure_plain_http.description: Only valid for OCI URL's. Allows insecure connections to registries without enforcing TLS checks

agent_env_vars.description: Optional Agent Env Vars for Rancher agent

default_pod_security_admission_configura.description: Default pod security admission configuration template name

agent_env_vars.description: Cluster V2 default agent env vars

cloud_credential_secret_name.description: Cluster V2 cloud credential secret name

default_cluster_role_for_project_members.description: Cluster V2 default cluster role for project members

default_pod_security_admission_configura.description: Cluster V2 default pod security admission configuration template name

inherited_cluster_roles.description: Names of role templates whose permissions are granted by this global role in every cluster besides the local cluster

new_user_default.description: Whether or not this role should be added to new users

annotations.description: Annotations of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

description.description: Description of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

labels.description: Labels of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

name.description: Name of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

project_id.description: Project ID where k8s namespace belongs

annotations.description: Annotations of the Pod Security Admission Configuration Template

defaults.description: defaults allows the user to define admission control mode for Pod Security

description.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration Template description

exemptions.description: exemptions allows the creation of pods for specific Usernames, RuntimeClassNames, and Namespaces that would otherwise be prohibited

labels.description: Labels of the Pod Security Admission Configuration Template

name.description: Pod Security Admission Configuration Template name

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster to whom the project belongs

namespace_id.description: Namespace ID to add docker registry

project_id.description: Project ID to add docker registry

default_role.description: Default role template for new created cluster or project

block.description: External policy rules used for authorization
